author: Howard Spindel
text:
I've a tree in my yard in a plight;
All its leaves are diseased — it's a sight.
And the skin of that tree
Peels to such a degree
That its bark is much worse than its blight.
question: What is the plight of the tree in my yard?

author: MikeAq
text:
Mr. Thistle, what's this all about?
All our rules you dismiss — baldly flout.
I have read your epistle;
It made my hairs bristle.
I'm blowing the whistle — you're out!
question: Does Mr. Thistle follow our rules?

author: MikeAq
text:
To compose a morose epicedium
Can brighten one's torpor and tedium.
I myself have an urge
To create a sad dirge —
One not overly mournful, just medium.
question: How can one brighten one's torpor and tedium?

author: MikeAq
text:
Cruciverbalists learn crosswordese,
Filling puzzles with words such as these:
Dies irae and busto —
Less-used words that you must know
To solve crossword puzzles with ease.
question: What do cruciverbalists learn?

author: Richard English
text:
Some folks might think cranberry glass
Is for fruit of the cranberry class.
But it's glass of deep red,
With a gold sheen, and said
To be sought by the English top brass.
question: What is sought by the English top brass?

author: neilski
text:
Dear fans, re the letters you write:
Peace and love, but I'm losing the fight.
From October, I'm sure,
They'll be answered no more:
I've no time. Peace and love, and goodnight.
question: From October, what will be answered no more?

author: Celia Warren
text:
Oh, don't throw your toys out your pram!
Yes, I treat all your emails as spam.
Hurt your feelings? Don't care;
I don't like you, so there!
Just accept that I don't give a damn!
question: Why do I treat all your emails as spam?

author: Janet McConnaughey
text:
"Hey, Mom, I've a chance at my dream —
The X-treme Harley Acrobats Team!"
She frowned at me, scaring
Me out of my daring:
She eyebrowed me out of my scheme.
question: How did mom scare me out of joining the X-treme Harley Acrobats Team?

author: Chris J. Strolin
text:
Our most serious faces we don
As the blamestorming session goes on.
Someone died. Who's to blame?
The one person we name
Is a janitor's helper named Juan.
question: Who do they blame in the blamestorming session after someone dies?

author: Chris Doyle
text:
I defined for my medical final
The adjective corticospinal:
To the spine it pertains
And the cortex (the brain's)—
Not the nose, 'cause that goes under rhinal.
question: To what does the corticospinal pertain?

author: SheilaB
text:
Uncle Wayne always gives me a pain.
His ideas are vain and inane.
He's both asinine (fatuous)
And a gas bag who's flatuous.
I treat the old fool with disdain.
question: What is wrong with Uncle Waynes ideas?
answer: Uncle Wayne's ideas are vain and inane.

author: Chris J. Strolin
text:
That damn call button jockey, room 9,
Is a pain in the base of my spine.
For no reason he rings
About minuscule things.
His sole purpose? To hear himself whine.
question: What is the sole purpose of the button jockey in room 9?
